page.title: 06Local History,Turvey
page.content: The village today owes much to the Higgins family.Charles Higgins purchased the estate at the end of the 18th century and sold part to his cousin John Higgins,who built Turvey House in 1797.Turvey Abbey was Charles Higgins main residence and his son Charles Longuet Higgins set about enlarging the parish church,rebuilding the insanitary estate cottages, erecting new schools and providing a reading room.The Lord Lieutenant of the County is the husband of a surviving member of the Higgins family and resides at Turvey House.He is Her Majesty's representative in the County and is in attendance when any member of the Royal family sets foot on Bedfordshire soil,even though many of these visits are private.
